description.content: Add -1 DICE to the roll. A model is in cover whenever it is in contact with a piece of scenery that is at least as long as the modelâ€™s base. If an attacker can see a model in its entirety, this penalty does not apply. A model cannot gain cover merely from being obscured due to angles, distant scenery or the surface that they are standing on (such as when standing on top of a building).
